bugs.title: CVE-2016-6261 libidn: Out of bounds stack read in idna_to_ascii_4i

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2016-6261 libidn: Out of bounds stack read in idna_to_ascii_4i

long_desc.thetext:
An out-of-bounds stack read was found in idna_to_ascii_4i.

Upstream patches:

http://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/libidn.git/commit/?id=f20ce1128fb7f4d33297eee307dddaf0f92ac72d

test: http://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/libidn.git/commit/?id=9a1a7e15d0706634971364493fbb06e77e74726c
changelog: http://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/libidn.git/commit/?id=d4c533a5d975bf49090d3cd40acd230b8f79dd32
fix for introduced memory leak: http://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/libidn.git/commit/?id=11abd0e02c16f9e0b6944aea4ef0f2df44b42dd4

CVE assignment:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2016/q3/124

Created libidn tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1359146]

Created mingw-libidn tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1359147]
Affects: epel-7 [bug 1359148]
libidn-1.33-1.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
libidn-1.33-1.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

bugs.title: CVE-2016-6262 libidn: Out-of-bounds read when reading zero byte as input

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2016-6262 libidn: Out-of-bounds read when reading zero byte as input

long_desc.thetext:
An out-of-bounds read was found in libidn when reading zero byte as input.

Upstream fix:

http://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/libidn.git/commit/?id=5e3cb9c7b5bf0ce665b9d68f5ddf095af5c9ba60

bugs.title: CVE-2015-8948 libidn: Out-of-bounds read due to use of fgets with fixed-size buffer

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-8948 libidn: Out-of-bounds read due to use of fgets with fixed-size buffer

long_desc.thetext:
An out-of-bounds read vulnerability was found in libidn due to the use of fgets with fixed-size buffer.

Upstream patch:

http://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/libidn.git/commit/?id=570e68886c41c2e765e6218cb317d9a9a447a041

CVE assignment:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2016/q3/124

bugs.title: CVE-2016-6263 libidn: Crash when given invalid UTF-8 data on input

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2016-6263 libidn: Crash when given invalid UTF-8 data on input

long_desc.thetext:
It was found that when presented with invalid UTF-8 data, stringprep_utf8_nfkc_normalize reject such input, causing application crash.

Upstream fix:

http://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/libidn.git/commit/?id=1fbee57ef3c72db2206dd87e4162108b2f425555
changelog: http://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/libidn.git/commit/?id=1d2413555dcd1fef26b80445a00a4637965a2df0

CVE assignment:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2016/q3/124

Created libidn tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1359146]

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1359148]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of Fedora.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

[bug automatically created by: add-tracking-bugs]

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1359145,1359141,1359138,1359134,1359147

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for CVE-2016-6263, CVE-2015-8948, CVE-2016-6262, CVE-2016-6261

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

mingw-libidn-1.33-1.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

Description of problem:
The distributed dll links to libintl.dll however, there is no internationalization expected or needed for this library in windows DLLs. It seems merely an unnecessary dependency. Please compile with --disable-nls support when generating the DLL to eliminate the unnecessary dependency.

Created attachment 1203997
libidn patch to remove libintl dependency

Attaching a spec patch to remove libintl dependency.
